009package Ch08_BinaryRegions;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016/**
017 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the calculation of horizontal and
018 * vertical projections on a grayscale image.
019 * 
020 * @author WB
021 *
022 */
023public class Make_Projections implements PlugInFilter {
024        
025        static boolean verbose = true;
026        static final int PSIZE = 150;   // size of projection bars
027        static final int FOREGROUND = 0;
028        static final int BACKGROUND = 255;
029        
030        ImagePlus origImage = null;
031        
032        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) { 
033                origImage = im;
034                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES; 
035        }
036        
037        public void run(ImageProcessor I) {
038                int M = I.getWidth();
039                int N = I.getHeight();
040                int[] pHor = new int[N];
041                int[] pVer = new int[M];
042                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
043                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
044                                int p = I.getPixel(u, v);
045                                pHor[v] +=  p;
046                                pVer[u] +=  p;
047                        }
048                }
049                
050                // make the horizontal projection:
051                ByteProcessor hP = new ByteProcessor(PSIZE,N);
052                hP.setValue(BACKGROUND); hP.fill();
053                hP.setValue(FOREGROUND);
054                double maxWhite = M * 255;
055                for (int row = 0; row < N; row++) {
056                        double black = (1 - pHor[row] / maxWhite);      // percentage of black in line 'row'
057                        int k = (int) (black * PSIZE);
058                        if (k > 0) {
059                                hP.drawLine(0, row, k, row);
060                        }
061                }
062                (new ImagePlus("Horiz. Proj", hP)).show();
063                                
064                // make the vertical projection:
065                ByteProcessor vP = new ByteProcessor(M,PSIZE);
066                vP.setValue(BACKGROUND); vP.fill();
067                vP.setValue(FOREGROUND);
068                maxWhite = N * 255;
069                for (int col = 0; col < M; col++) {
070                        double black = (1 - pVer[col] / maxWhite);      // percentage of black in column 'col'
071                        int k = (int) (black * PSIZE);
072                        if (k > 0) {
073                                vP.drawLine(col, 0, col, k);
074                        }
075                }
076                (new ImagePlus("Vert. Proj", vP)).show();
077        }
078
079}
